Get an edge data frame from a graph

Source: R/get_edge_df.R
get_edge_df.Rd

From a graph, obtain an edge data frame with all current edge attributes.

get_edge_df(graph)

Arguments

graph

a graph object of class dgr_graph.

Value

an edge data frame.

Examples

# Create a graph
graph <-
  create_graph() %>%
  add_n_nodes(
    n = 1,
    type = "a") %>%
  select_last_nodes_created() %>%
  add_n_nodes_ws(
    n = 5,
    direction = "from",
    type = "b") %>%
  select_edges_by_node_id(
    nodes = 3:5) %>%
  set_edge_attrs_ws(
    edge_attr = color,
    value = "green") %>%
  set_edge_attrs_ws(
    edge_attr = rel,
    value = "a") %>%
  invert_selection %>%
  set_edge_attrs_ws(
    edge_attr = color,
    value = "blue") %>%
  set_edge_attrs_ws(
    edge_attr = rel,
    value = "b") %>%
  clear_selection()
#> `select_edges_by_node_id()` INFO: created a new selection of3 edges:
#> * this replaces1 nodein the prior selection
#> `invert_selection()` INFO: inverted an existing selection of 3 edges:
#> * 2 edges are now in the active selection
#> `clear_selection()` INFO: cleared an existing selection of 2 edges

# Get the graph's internal
# edge data frame (edf)
graph %>% get_edge_df()
#>   id from to rel color
#> 1  1    1  2   b  blue
#> 2  2    1  3   a green
#> 3  3    1  4   a green
#> 4  4    1  5   a green
#> 5  5    1  6   b  blue
